channel.title: Block sentences?
channel.description:
any way to stop some1 from saying there chat if it contains a word? uppercase or lowercase?
like if they say...
"join *server-ip-here* for free gay anal"
how would i make it block out no-ip or servegame?
shortest code possible?
maybe osmething that reads from an array or something? :D like say i wanna block out 50 different words, best way to do that? :D

item.title: Block sentences?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:6, topic:278748”]“just not allow the text to go through”

Don’t allow it, and send a message to the specific player only saying that they can’t advertise.[/quote]That’s what returning does…

if (misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2).contains(".biz")) { sendMessage("DON'T ADVERTISE FAGGOT."); return; }

^^ Would send a message to the player telling them not to advertise and block their message from being sent.

Read full topic

item.title: Block sentences?
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

“just not allow the text to go through”

Don’t allow it, and send a message to the specific player only saying that they can’t advertise.

Read full topic

item.title: Block sentences?
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

bcuz wat if they are trying to advertise? it won’t stop them… i rather just have the msg not be sent

item.title: Block sentences?
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Why, instead of returning, not just not allow the text to go through, and have a message telling the player not to advertise be sent?

Read full topic

item.title: Block sentences?
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

well o.o o.o, i alredy got it working… but i was hoping some1 hsa a smaller code…

this is wat i have in case 4 to have it block out some of the bad stuff like…
lets say i don’t want any1 to say .biz, i would put this

		if (misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2).contains(".biz")) {
			return;
		}

it blocked out phrases with .biz in the line

HOWEVER
it doesn’t owrk all the time… any1 got a smaller code?

Read full topic
